data.message: Why not plugins for your IDE/Editor, I'm using ST3 and it has many JS lint plugins
This is not a syntax error.
Use ESLint and integrate it with your editor/ide and your task runner /pipeline

First, semi-colons are optional in JS. So that's not a syntax error. 

It just became a good a very well & established best practice to use them because of how the runtime will add semi colons for you (Google JavaScript automatic semi colon insertion or ASI) which can lead to subtle errors if you don't know how it works. 

To catch these kind of errors use ESLint in your editor of choice. 

ESLint can work as you want, so if you want to keep writing with semi-colons then it can catch if you miss any & also if you want to write without semi-colons it can tell you when this might break. 


For example this is an opinionated ESLint config that works without semi-colons. 

http://standardjs.com

And this another one that works with semi-colons

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb

I'm usually using 3 methods
JSlint & JSHint & "use strict"; mode
Those three should make you write clean and clear code.
